paragraphs.text:
%md

## Data Science in Apache Spark
### Mushrooms Workbook
#### Random Forest Classifier

**Level**: Moderate
**Language**: Scala
**Requirements**: 
- [HDP 2.6.X]
- Spark 2.x

**Author**: Ian Brooks
**Follow** [LinkedIn - Ian Brooks PhD] (https://www.linkedin.com/in/ianrbrooksphd/)

What would Bear do?  
![alt text][logo]

[logo]:https://static.thenortheasttoday.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/BearGrylls-800x445.png

## Pre-Run Instructions

**File Upload:** Upload the source data file MushroomDatabase.csv to HDFS in the /tmp directory

msg.data:
Data Science in Apache Spark

Mushrooms Workbook

Random Forest Classifier

Level: Moderate
Language: Scala
Requirements:
- [HDP 2.6.X]
- Spark 2.x

Author: Ian Brooks
Follow LinkedIn - Ian Brooks PhD

What would Bear do?

Pre-Run Instructions

File Upload: Upload the source data file MushroomDatabase.csv to HDFS in the /tmp directory

Must be used before SparkInterpreter (%spark) initialized
Hint: put this paragraph before any Spark code and restart Zeppelin/Interpreter

paragraphs.title: initialize Spark Session
paragraphs.text:
%spark2

import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession
val spark: SparkSession = SparkSession.builder
  .appName("MushroomClassifier")  // optional and will be autogenerated if not specified
  .master("local[*]")               // avoid hardcoding the deployment environment
  .enableHiveSupport()              // self-explanatory, isn't it?
  .config("spark.sql.warehouse.dir", "target/spark-warehouse")
  .getOrCreate

spark.version

paragraphs.title: Mushroom Distribution
paragraphs.text:
%sql

select Label, count(Label) from RawMushData group by Label

paragraphs.title: Odor By Poisonous
paragraphs.text:
%sql

select Label, Odor, count(Odor) from RawMushData group by Odor, Label

paragraphs.title: Create Test and Train Sets
paragraphs.text:
%spark2
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.{IndexToString, StringIndexer}

val splits = FeatureVector.randomSplit(Array(0.8, 0.2))
val df_TrainSet = splits(0)
val df_TestSet = splits(1)

df_TrainSet.printSchema()

val converter = new IndexToString()
  .setInputCol("Label_Index")
  .setOutputCol("originalLabel")

val converted = converter.transform(df_TrainSet)

converted.take(1)

paragraphs.title: Train and Run Model
paragraphs.text:
%spark2

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassificationModel
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassifier
import org.apache.spark.ml.evaluation.BinaryClassificationEvaluator
import org.apache.spark.ml.tuning.{ParamGridBuilder, CrossValidator}
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorSlicer

// Train a RandomForest model.
val rf_classifier = new RandomForestClassifier()
        .setLabelCol("Label_Index")
        .setFeaturesCol("features")
        .setNumTrees(150)
        .setMaxBins(200)
        //.setThresholds(Array(0.45,0.75,0.55,0.55,0.55,0.55,0.55,0.55,0.55,0.55))
        
//Set up Evalution for Cross-Validation 
//val metric = "accuracy"
val CV_evaluator = new BinaryClassificationEvaluator()
  .setLabelCol("Label_Index")
  .setRawPredictionCol("prediction")
//  .setMetricName(metric)

//Set up grid search for model parameters 
val paramGrid = new ParamGridBuilder()
    .addGrid(rf_classifier.numTrees, Array(50, 150, 350))
    .build()

val cv = new CrossValidator()
  .setEstimator(rf_classifier)
  .setEvaluator(CV_evaluator) 
  .setEstimatorParamMaps(paramGrid)
  .setNumFolds(3)        
        
// Train model
val model = cv.fit(df_TrainSet)

// Make predictions for Model Evaluation
val Predictions = model.transform(df_TestSet)

val Results = Predictions.select("Label","Label_Index","prediction","CapShape", "CapSurface", "CapColor", "Bruises","Odor", "GillAttachment", "GillSpacing", "GillSize", "GillColor", "StalkShape", "StalkRoot", "SSAR", "SSBR", "SCAR", "SCBR", "VeilType", "VeilColor", "RingNumber", "RingType", "SporePrintColor", "Population", "Habitat")

// Select example rows to display.
Results.createOrReplaceTempView("MushResults")

paragraphs.title: Model Evaluation
paragraphs.text:
%spark2
import org.apache.spark.mllib.evaluation.BinaryClassificationMetrics
import org.apache.spark.mllib.regression.LabeledPoint 

val metrics = new BinaryClassificationEvaluator()
  .setLabelCol("Label_Index")
  .setRawPredictionCol("prediction")
  .setMetricName("areaUnderROC")
val areaUnderROC = metrics.evaluate(Predictions)
println("Area Under ROC = " + areaUnderROC)

val metrics = new BinaryClassificationEvaluator()
  .setLabelCol("Label_Index")
  .setRawPredictionCol("prediction")
  .setMetricName("areaUnderPR")
val areaUnderPRC = metrics.evaluate(Predictions)
println("Area Under PRC = " + areaUnderPRC)

val df_LabeledSet = Results.select("prediction", "Label_Index").rdd

val predictionAndLabels =  df_LabeledSet.map { row => (row(0).asInstanceOf[Double], row(1).asInstanceOf[Double])} 

//predictionAndLabels.count()

// Instantiate metrics object
val metrics = new BinaryClassificationMetrics(predictionAndLabels )

// Precision by threshold
val precision = metrics.precisionByThreshold.collect()

precision.foreach { case (t, p) =>
  println(s"Threshold: $t, Precision: $p")
}

// Recall by threshold
val recall = metrics.recallByThreshold.collect()

recall.foreach { case (t, r) =>
  println(s"Threshold: $t, Recall: $r")
}

// Precision-Recall Curve
val PRC = metrics.pr.collect()

// F-measure
val f1Score = metrics.fMeasureByThreshold.collect()

f1Score.foreach { case (t, f) =>
  println(s"Threshold: $t, F-score: $f, Beta = 1")
}

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.mllib.evaluation.BinaryClassificationMetrics

import org.apache.spark.mllib.regression.LabeledPoint

metrics: org.apache.spark.ml.evaluation.BinaryClassificationEvaluator = binEval_d1e3efe8926d

areaUnderROC: Double = 1.0
Area Under ROC = 1.0

paragraphs.title: Feature Ranking
paragraphs.text:
%spark2

val rf_model = rf_classifier.fit(df_TestSet)

val features = df_TestSet.select("features")

val featureImp = rf_model.featureImportances

featureImp.toArray.zip(featureList).map(_.swap).sortBy(-_._2).foreach(x => println(x._1 + " -> " + x._2))
